articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Dominant 7b5 in E (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Dominant 7b5 in E

## Brief Presentation
The Dominant 7b5 arpeggio in E is a four-note arpeggio that consists of the notes E, G#, B, and Db. Also known as the Half-Diminished 7 arpeggio, this arpeggio has a spicy and dissonant sound due to the flattened 5th (b5) interval. It is commonly used in jazz and fusion music to add tension and color to chord progressions.

## Notes and Intervals
- E (Root)
- G# (Major 3rd)
- B (Perfect 5th)
- Db (Minor 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Dominant 7b5 arpeggio is often used in genres such as jazz, fusion, and progressive rock. Its dissonant and intense sound quality adds complexity and sophistication to compositions. When played in a harmonic context, it can create a sense of tension that resolves beautifully to the resolving chord.

## Songs
Here are three songs that use the Dominant 7b5 arpeggio in E:
1. "Giant Steps" by John Coltrane
2. "Birdland" by Weather Report
3. "The Dance of Eternity" by Dream Theater
